DM [CreamPuff] BOT 27-09-2023 20:09
The moose lets out a bleat of panic as two of its hooves begin to slip off of the edge of the bridge, as it makes one more desperate attempt to shove back...
Nightwalker (Polymorph Lars) BOT 27-09-2023 20:14
*Lars(?) seems to find an opening, the hooves slipping offer less resistance and there's this moment where the moose slips. Capitalizing on that fleeting weakness, the large shadow-man pulls instead of pushing, arcing his back and lifting the animal a couple feet off the ground, before taking a struggled step forward and body-slamming it into the waters below. A echoing roar booms out as it senses it's victory, turning to face his next opponent. No, not the giant. It's looking back at the party, blueish eyes glowing with a hint of... malice.*

Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-09-2023 07:53

If he was to say that he met a frost giant in the wild, and someone asked him to describe the encounter, it would go something like this. So his group was on their merry way to go pluck glowing mushrooms off the slopes in the absolute frozen cold of Mt. Ghakis when they met a giant trying to brush the antlers of a moose with the branch of a tree. When he saw the group, he did not move, and decided to pick a fight by flinging a boulder-sized booger in the river. A comrade of Yuki's transformed into a shallot-shaped shadow who swung a moose into the river before entering a sumo match with the giant, which turned to be quite entertaining with the back and forth and close calls, while another comrade was shouting encouragements about proud mamas and deep philosophical statements about pushing, a bit like a mother assisting her daughter in childbirth. Meanwhile, his third companion had starting a casual conversation with another moose. That one sounded more like a therapy, but the whole thing sounded more like deep moanings and rising excitement, so he stopped listening. The encounter seems to have been resolved by basically throwing a small warm stone at the giant. And then they could pass. The end (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 30-09-2023 12:29
Yuki doesn't reply to Lars. He gets lost in his own thoughts, walking forward. A dark side of himself? A monster within? He understands what Lars means; all those bottled emotions, the desires, the urges. It's not like he can't feel them. He is just able to keep them in check. But then again, it doesn't feel like Lars loses control over his emotions and gets completely taken by them, either. The way he explains it, it's more like letting them loose and using them through magic. As he said, it was a spell. A spell... This notion brings him back to reality. Yuki could do a lot of things, but magic wasn't one of them. He's never tried. Never had a use for it. It was pretty rare and pretty tame in his village, there wasn't really any magic user that could spread their expertise. So he never leaned that way. No one did. It was impossible for him. At least in his current state, with his current knowledge. But deep down, he can't help but wonder... What would he look like in his shadow self?

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 01-10-2023 09:45
*As the party departs from the bridge and leaves the tired giant and grateful moose behind, they find the climb eastward toward the peak of Mt. Ghakis to be steeper, rockier, and snowier. Now that the temperature feels below freezing, the party huddles together as they walk around the remaining thermal cubes. Some thirty minutes more hiking, they come to a little rocky outcrop among the snow that seems like a fitting place to get some shelter from the cold winds to catch a breath. The light of day is dropping quite low on the horizon, and the party knows it will be maybe half an hour more to their destination, at which point it will also be sundown.*
Riannoc BOT 01-10-2023 20:43

Lars BOT 01-10-2023 21:28

1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 02-10-2023 00:09
"You're both right," Yuki chimes in. "Go too fast and we indeed risk alerting everything around us of our presence. Not only that, but we now have a more dangerous terrain, with potential hidden crevices, ice patches, potholes, and the likes. Hazards we don't want to blindly walk into." "But go too slow, and we have increased risks of frostbites, having to sleep in the mountains, and just overall wasting precious time." "So in my opinion, we should keep moving forward and keep pace, but be aware and careful of our surroundings. We aren't far anyway." On that note, Yuki picks up his things and gets ready to head out once more. "As Rannaroc said, if we could at least get to the mushroom area before sundown, that would be best."

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 03-10-2023 09:00
*As the party pushes on, the sky quickly darkens above them and the cold winds have become biting and merciless. The party huddles together near the thermal cube and are protected from the freezing cold, a truly strange sensation, but the sleet storm has reduced visibility quite a bit. Arriving on the snowy mountain side where Kasimir pointed you to, just ten or twenty minutes before you would reach the entrance to the temple ruins that have been rumored to be cursed, you begin searching for a cave along the dangerous, steep, and sometimes slippery slopes. After some time of stumbling, slipping, and tapping your feet on a number of snowy banks -- Nyr's foot sticks through a pile of snow and it collapses to reveal the mouth of a cave. It's completely dark within and no wind is howling out of it, indicating that it doesn't seem to have an outlet on the other end.*

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 04-10-2023 03:15

Riannoc BOT 04-10-2023 08:22

Yuki Northernfur BOT 04-10-2023 10:40
"I've seen something similar in the mountains where I'm from," Yuki says, crouched in front of the skeletons to observe them better. "They were most likely bears. They may look like they starved to deaths, but bears can survive around 100 days without eating, drinking, or passing waste. Hell, they can even turn their piss into proteins." "So what I think is that they were either wounded and that's what killed them, or..." He stands up and looks towards the entrance of the cave. "Or something out there was so scary and threatening that they preferred this death to risking going outside again." A shiver runs along his spine despite telling himself that they were fine. Hopefully.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 05-10-2023 03:59
Now that the team is a bit more accustomed to the raging sleet storm and have experience with what kind of snowy banks are more likely to yield a hidden cave mouth, they are a lot quicker at scaling the mountain sides and pushing with their boots until Lars's boots -- wet from all the sleet melting in 95 degree hot air -- sinks through another bank of snow that looked solid at first but gives way to a wide, dark opening as the powder sinks and parts. This one, surprisingly doesn't smell as wet as the last one.
Nyr BOT 05-10-2023 23:12
"Surely this is the right cave. Who would of thought there would be so many in the area?" He looks in and let's his eyes adjust to the darkness before continueing "Helllooooo....little wierd glowing mushrooms, you in there?" The weather is making Nyr delirious
Riannoc BOT 05-10-2023 23:29
‚ÄúAnything will do, let‚Äôs just get in before the weather gets you.‚Äù He steps forward, using his eyes to see through the darkness.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 06-10-2023 00:34
Yuki enters warily. The dry air makes him think that mushrooms may have a harder time growing here, as mushrooms are around 90% water, but then again, he isn't a botanist. He doesn't know all the kinds of mushrooms in the world, especially in this unknown and surprising plane, and after all, mushrooms aren't known to grow in cold and snowy regions, yet here they are looking for them. It's entirely possible they could grow here, so it's worth checking out. He enters, keeping his eyes and ears open, ready to react to anything that may come their way, while also looking around for the purpose of their visit. "Let's check this place quickly, I don't like being in narrow areas," he announces in a low voice to the others.
Lars BOT 06-10-2023 01:48
"You must be terribly uncomfortable in this limited plane." He also shimmies in, extremely close to the warm stones of Yuki and Nyr.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 06-10-2023 01:53
He thinks for a second, but then slowly shakes his head. "No, being surrounded by mist is not the same as being imprisoned by walls. The reason I don't like narrow, enclosed spaces like caves is because my fighting style is based on movements, and my attacks are done at a distance. I can't do either well in cramped locations, so I don't like to go in places that essentially limit my combat abilities," he explains.
Lars BOT 06-10-2023 08:17
He looks at you for a moment. - I understand. However... you don't seem nearly as desperate to leave as some of the others. Have you accepted your fate here, Yuki? Great time to talk about this stuff, Lars. You're definitely NOT walking inside a mysterious cave, full of possible vampires, yetis, giants, dragons, hags, or some other horrific creature.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 06-10-2023 12:30
Yuki scoffs. "Not desperate to leave? I'm braving the frozen slopes of Mt. Ghakis and its inhabitants in hopes to find mushrooms that allegedly would allow me to purposely ingest deadly poison so I could, in theory only, have solely my mind escape this place for a short period of time. How much more absurdly would I need to act to look desperate to you?" "Short of attacking vampire-boy himself, I don't think many can top the insanity in which the four of us embarked. I don't look desperate, because I try to keep my wits about me and make calculated risks. The line between desperation and stupidity is a fine one, and I want to stay on the right side of it." "But I think this is a discussion for another time. Let's keep our eyes peeled and find these fungi so we can get back down this cursed rock."

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 07-10-2023 07:56
*As Yuki and Lars converses with great intensity in hushed tones, the party glances around the cave they have found themselves in -- much more spacious than the last one they attempted to explore. With his sharp sight, Nyr would spot a few footprints in the snow -- they look much, much larger than a normal humanoid's footprint. Riannoc's sensitive nose, as a baker and connoisseur of tea, picks up the scent of ... something furry. Furry and wet. Multiple creatures, perhaps, from deeper within the cave. Yuki's sharp shifter hearing picks up the low, almost imperceptible breathing of large creatures, not yet within vision. The rate of breathing is quite low; not as infrequent as creatures in hibernation, which Yuki would know well based on his background, which might indicate that these are creatures well adapted to the cold since they might have lower metabolism. Last but not least, Lars would spot a little glow in an alcove of the cave -- perhaps a bioluminescent one Kasimir described coming from the mushrooms?!*
Riannoc BOT 07-10-2023 09:19

Lars BOT 07-10-2023 10:56

Yuki Northernfur BOT 07-10-2023 13:09
"These may be larger than bears, actually. I can't see them, but I can still hear them from here," he whispers to the others. He looks at Lars gesticulate for a few seconds, but having no clue as to what he means, as well as having a gut feeling that Lars himself may not know what he was gesturing, Yuki decides to continue as if nothing happened. "We might be dealing with cold-resistant creatures on their own turf. We would be at a disadvantage before the fight even started. The best we can do is slowly, carefully, and sneakily enter to identify what we're facing, and act accordingly. Be ready to flee." He unsnaps his bow from his back. For the trained eyes, they would notice that it is missing its bowstring, yet Yuki doesn't seem to mind. Or maybe he isn't aware? He turns to Nyr. "I think I remember you having quite the array in terms of projectiles. Would you have something that can go boom enough to break the entrance and create a cave-in so to prevent whatever is inside from getting out shall we need to run?"
Riannoc BOT 07-10-2023 15:44

Yuki Northernfur BOT 08-10-2023 00:25

He then looks at Lars who is still gesturing something that looks like a stick with his right hand finger and a hole with his left, his right finger going back and forth through the hole. Is he suggesting that they poke whatever is inside the cave with their swords? His eyes go back to Riannoc. "But if you say you can make this cave go boom, then could all of you be ready to do so shall we need to?" He steps forward to catch up with Lars who now seems to be gesturing holding something at about waist height with his left hand and hitting it with his flat right hand repeatedly in a round motion. "I don't think the first thing we should do is slap whatever we'll find. I'll go scout ahead. Try to keep yourselves concealed, don't rush in, and Lars, don't poke anything with your stick." Yuki then advances sneakily in the depths, trying to ascertain what is residing inside them. (edited)

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 10-10-2023 02:30

Lars BOT 10-10-2023 09:09

Yuki Northernfur BOT 11-10-2023 01:50

Yuki Northernfur BOT 13-10-2023 00:33
As he looks at the huge dragon roaring and spitting fire, feeling the heat and ground shake under its stomps, Yuki is glad he knows it's an illusion. Even knowing it is, there's a sense of instinctual wariness. That illusion is as lifelike as anything he's seen in real life, and he would have a hard time believing it wasn't real, even if told, if he hadn't seen Riannoc literally cast it to life. Very well done. And the yetis and trolls who are coming to check out the group seem to think similarly, because it only takes a glance for them to turn around on a dime and run for their lives. Yuki feels that this would give him the perfect opportunity to go and grab that mushroom before it gets crushed in the mayhem. Once again, he transforms into his shifter's arctic fox shape. To make sure he goes as fast as possible, he decides to use all four limbs to dash ahead. In between two breaths of fire, a white streak is seen, and tiny snowflakes dance in the air for a second before another wave of heat makes them melt on the spot. Yuki hops and goes as fast as he can and slide stops in front of the mushroom to pick it up, and gently bites it to keep it in his mouth before double backing and rushing back towards his companions on all fours. Once back, he stands up, opens his Bag of Holding, and releases the mushroom from the grip of his fangs. The group can see the fungus fall into the bag. "That's one. Three to go," he growls. (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 13-10-2023 13:13

But looking around at his companions, he realizes that the additional agility his shifter's form gives him along with his natural ability to blend into his surroundings makes him the ideal choice if they have no choice but to leave one person out of invisibility. So now, he's still less than thrilled, but he understands that the situation calls for it. "Fine," he agrees in his deeper-than-normal, husky voice. "Let's just say you guys owe me a favor later." Yuki Northernfur BOT 15-10-2023 02:06
Seeing the trolls and yetis coming their way to escape the illusion, Yuki also notices that one of them wants to play the hero and attack the dragon. To preserve the integrity of what is essentially allowing them to avoid a huge fight, Yuki decides it's time to act and get rid of that variable. Starting to run, he hops on a protruding rock, then on Riannoc's shoulders. Propulsing from there, Yuki makes a beautiful spinning side flip over the two apes, who are too panicked, surprised, and awestruck to even think about swinging at this gracefully flying white fox. On the other side, Yuki lands on his feet to roll into shooting position. He takes his bow and pinches the air where the bowstring would be. From his fingers two fine sparks of light move in a straight line towards the each bow extremities, creating a bowstring of light where it seemed to be missing. As he pulls the bowstring to aim, a thick line of light is created to form an arrow. Little sparks of light emanate from the bow and the arrow, a soothing sight in the dark and cold environment they find themselves in. Yuki lets go. The arrow flies straight and true, hitting the yeti right between the shoulder blades, at that one spot that large individuals can't reach with their arms. He slides away from sight and near a pillar as the ape yells in pain, unknowing of Lars' presence besides him.

Nyr BOT 15-10-2023 02:58

Left were Nyr was standing is a Dreadful version of himself. Shadowy tendrils escaping his body, a dark animalistic skull covering his face, glowing blue eyes piercing from the dark sockets, his form seems to float a couple inches above the ground Too bad no one can see his cool transformation with the invisibility and all. Out of nowhere comes a voice, half whispered echo, half demonic growl "Death" And just like that, two shadow consumed arrows come screeching out of nowhere. A trail of desperate screams of agony following them. One connects with the Yeti, the shadow seeping into its own eyes frightening it. Hovering on a cloud of shadowy tendrils is the Dread Wanderer Nyr. His bow alight with thousands of glowing blue eyes. The eyes of screaming faces elegantly carved into the wood. Their mouths open in agony, shadows spilling out. (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 18-10-2023 15:05
Yuki moves forward silently, keeping his eyes peeled and his ears sharp. He tries to smell the air as well, but there is so much animal stink, like wet fur and possibly urine, that he quickly decides to use his other senses. And this persistent burnt wood odor that still seems to be on him.... He's looking forward to a shower for sure. He hasn't walked very far that a small breathing noise catches his attention. He stops dead in his tracks and looks over his shoulder. He can see his companions only a few paces away, so he carefully threads back. "I found the yeti that escaped this way earlier," he whispers once back to the group. "At least, I think it's the same... Could be something different, but it sounds pretty large. We could ambush it and try to take it down, but it's a risk. Liannoc, do you still have your dragon? Or do we have any other ideas?" (edited)
Riannoc BOT 18-10-2023 15:23
"No, let's not 'Riannoc, where's your dragon' every problem we come across. At least until we know what's inside. That is to say, if there's an actual dragon named Strawberryx then I imagine we'll be in trouble." He ponders for a second, then offers another idea. "Say, this... ape furry creature, they stared at you and makes you unable to move...? What if I just summon my ravens to conceal the light? Provided you all don't mind fighting in complete darkness." The shadows behind the elf flickers as he offers his suggestion.
Lars BOT 18-10-2023 15:40
- I'm pretty sure all of us mind the complete darkness, except you. He adjusts the grip on his spear, thinking. - But it's better than whatever happened to Nyr.
Nyr BOT 18-10-2023 19:11
"It wasn't all bad. I mean, the psychological affect of seeing my death coming and being frozen in place and defenseless might be interesting to unpack later. But physically...it was just mildly excruciating"
1
Riannoc BOT 18-10-2023 20:44
‚ÄúFine, lights out it is.‚Äù *Just as soon as he finishes talking. His swarm of shadow ravens rises up from beneath his feet, engulfing hus surroundings. An old trick, but one that has always worked when it counts. All the others would see is his pair of amber eyes, glinting in the darkness. But that too, fades like fallen snow in spring.* ‚ÄúJust stay close so I can tell you where to aim.‚Äù
Lars BOT 18-10-2023 21:45

Yuki Northernfur BOT 19-10-2023 00:20

The beast shouts in pain and its head spins instantly towards Yuki as he makes his way back to his friends. "I think it knows we're here now...." (edited)

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 19-10-2023 15:31

It begins flailing its arms and its claws cleaves into the shadar, even though he successfully deflects the other claw.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 19-10-2023 15:44
Magical darkness is a weird thing. It's like looking in a deep water surface that reflects nothing. Except you're not sure if you're looking at a liquid or a gas. Sometimes fog, sometimes opaque. Like smoke trapped in a bottle. It's both beautiful and disconcerting. Hearing noise but not seeing anything, Yuki decides to dive through and come on the other side. Going in a straight line, what could go wrong? And so, lucky enough that he didn't hit anything, he emerges on the other side. As he did before, he pulls and shoots an arrow of light at the yeti. Straight and true, it hits him in its side. It yelps in pain, trying to grab the arrow, but it has already disappeared, leaving a burnt mark. Yuki knows that this burn mark can go quite a few inches deep into flesh. It must hurt, for sure. That yeti sure seems like it's getting pissed... And Yuki sure seems like the type of guy who wants to be away from pissed off beasts. Therefore, he runs back in the sphere of cold, lonely darkness, to emerge back on the other side again, where he started. And he realizes now that every time he goes through, he holds his breath... Does he have to? Surely not. But it's so instinctual....

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 25-10-2023 03:26
As Yuki pushes deeper into the cave with his keen sight, he sees two faint glows coming from the northwest, a faint white glow familiar to him -- indicating the presence of a mushroom, and a shimmering, warm yellow glow that he already noticed before, coming down another cavern passage.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 25-10-2023 06:17
As Yuki advances further, a warm glow of yellow-orangish color attracts his attention. That is not something they have encountered yet, and it makes him stop in his tracks. This is confirmed when another glow enters his line of sight, further north. Yuki would bet that the latter one, whitish in color, is another mushroom. It would match what they have seen before. So what about the yellow one? What could it be? A torch? A magical phenomenon? Can any creature glow like that? Does he actually want to or need to find out? The only question he can answer with some certainty is the last one; nope. It can glow all by itself and everything would probably be peachy. But then he notices it. Is the glow in the northwest really as white as it should be? He remembers the other ones being purer. That one is more like‚Ä¶ beige. It occurs to him that this may be the mix of the mushroom‚Äôs white and the yellow of whatever that other thing is. There are multiple of them!? Shit! He goes back a little to warn his companions. ‚ÄúI think I found another mushroom further north. I also see some sort of yellowish glow that does not correspond to the mushroom halos we‚Äôve seen so far. I don‚Äôt particularly want to know what it belongs to, but I think we‚Äôll have to find out because there seems to be one near our target. Follow me, but stay hidden, and as silent as possible.‚Äù He starts making his way through the tunnels towards the white glow, keeping his eyes open in case there are any other surprises in the deeper chambers, hoping his friends will follow as carefully as they can. Yuki Northernfur BOT 26-10-2023 00:10
Yuki is about to push forward when lights go off again. He's not a big fan of magical darkness, he realizes. He feels Riannoc take his hand and put something in it. Something hard, about two inches thick. He feels like Lars would have some comment to say about this... Yuki nods and the sphere retreats, bringing his vision back to normal. Once out of that ball of void, the surroundings, as black as they are, seem so bright. He keeps pace, looking at the object in his hand. A wand? What does it do?... Why didn't Riannoc tell him what it does?! Wave it when he sees fit?.... Is now fit?... Only one way to find out. He waves the wand around as he walks. Nothing happens. Did he do it right? Magic stuff, man, it's always so complicated! He gets to an intersection. He can see the mushroom on the right. It turns out it's all by itself, so he could go pluck it and come back real quick. The yellow-orangish glow to the left seems to be coming from a small fire source. Like a candle, a lamp, or a tiny bonfire made by cockroaches to celebrate one of them having been told "eww a cockroach!" for the 500th time. A druid once told him the critters keep count of those things and celebrate them as achievements. They rank themselves that way. The more ewws, the more power in the group. But he digresses. *He'll wait for the others before moving on.... .... .... What does the wand do?!?* (edited)

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 28-10-2023 00:15

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 29-10-2023 08:03
As the lantern is lifted, its light remains. Its warm glow does not bring comfort. Instead, when it's brought nearer, Riannoc feels a dreadful, desperate, hopeless sense of being lost. *Is this the right path? Are you crazy, going deeper into a yeti and troll's cave? Where exactly where you going anyway? What's your goal? What's your destination? What's your purpose? Nevermind making it out of the mists... will you even make it out to see Vesperhale again? Will you get to taste the fragrant tea that is brewed out of your trusty wagon ever again?*
Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-10-2023 12:27
Yuki hurries back to his companion, a smile on his face imagining their reaction when he'll tell them they are only one mushroom away to having all they need. They were pretty lucky finding three of them in the same cave, and there seems to be more depths to the tunnels. He's fairly confident they can find the fourth one here as well. But as he gets closer to his comrades, his smile fades away. Were they going to find the last one here? If not, they would have to spend even more time on this blasted mountain. That doesn't sound nice at all... When Yuki gets within one or two dozen feet from the others, he stops. Are they really looking for mushrooms in this frozen cave? For what? To eat deadly poison? What for? To go into some other plane to face some unknown entity, one that will most likely want their skins? They are risking their lives in the cave, to risk their lives eating poison, to risk their lives hunting someone? Why?! What do they get out of this? What does he get out of this? He's know these people for only a few days. Why would he have to go that far for them? Yuki turns around and starts walking towards where they came from. The tunnels look darker than before, the walls thicker, the corridors narrower. Suffocating. He already doesn't like these kinds of places. But now, he feels like he could get buried and die alone here at any time. At the intersection, he wonders for a moment. It would be so easy to just keep going the way he came. All the way out. He wants to. He wants to go back to Barovia. What is this folly in a frozen hole? What did he get into? He tries to hide but can only do so half-heartedly. He misses his family. His village, Winterspine, on the familiar mountain range of Ice Claws. Not this damned rock surrounded by mist. As he gets further and further away from the group, however, he notices the feelings receding. He stops again and looks back. He is torn. His heart is heavy. Stay or go? Stay or go?

Lars BOT 30-10-2023 09:13
*Staying in his advantageous position, Lars keeps both eyes very much open to spring into action. But he sees Yuki walking back, a weird look in his eyes. Yuki Northernfur BOT 30-10-2023 12:48

Sorry, I just... spaced out there for a moment. I had this... strange feeling creep its way into me. Very unusual. It felt like what we are doing is pointless. We would die here, or get trapped." "But over all else, there was this feeling of... loneliness. Like I didn't belong. I haven't been around you three as much as you've been around each other, after all. I felt like a fourth wheel on a tricycle. And a forlorn mindset set in." He stops for a second to better reach inside his own heart, looking at his own feelings. "Interestingly, it's pretty much gone now. It was strongest when I was close to you guys earlier." Something nudges his brain at these words. "You guys... You weren't doing anything weird now, were you? Did you meet someone? Did you find a rune? Did you touch something?"
Riannoc BOT 30-10-2023 13:44
Riannoc was always at ease in the darkness, the cold and silence reminds him of home, however far and distant it is. Home that he ran away from, but one that he sought to change. One day he would return and change how his people should live, under the sun, like everyone else. No other shadar child must suffer the lack of its warmth, nor any should fear the teeth and claws lurking in the shadows. And that day seems so distant, so far away. What is he doing in this dark cave? What is the significance of all this? *He takes a step, a heavy lumbering as he drags his right leg. Oh that's right, he is crippled on one leg. A minor inconvenience compared to all other shadar orphans in the streets that are no better than corpses under the moonless sky.* *What business is a cripple doing on the mountain so high? What business does a pathetic cripple have to dream of a better world? Slowly the glowing of the lantern gets so close to the darkness. Look at Little John, so thoughtless, so simple, just doing its job. How envious.* ... <Slap> And Little John would very rudely apply a wake up slap to the shadow elf as the light of consciousness returns to his eyes. Just enough for him to reply to his allies. "No, I did not touch anything. But the scroll... and this lantern... they're... something. Be careful what you pick up in this place. There's awful magic causing us to feel things we should not." "...things we should not" he says.

Lars BOT 30-10-2023 15:36

1
Nyr BOT 30-10-2023 20:06
Nyr was no stranger to loneliness. He was no stranger to hopelessness. In fact, he was most comfortable with these feelings, they were a part of him, they were home. When you live with such emotions everyday, you tend to be numb towards them. That's what surprised him the most when this new wave of emotions hit. This was something else, an external force pushing itself in. He had grown accustomed to the negative thoughts in his heart. Nyr wasn't prepared for this. What the hell were they doing here? There was no point to any of this. Nothing was bringing her back, especially vengeance. He's willingly risking the lives of his only friends, the only people to make him forget the loneliness, for nothing. idiot. The sound of his companions voices shakes him out of it. "We're not meant to know of our own deaths...that mask is a travesty. One mushroom to go. Stop touching things, let's get this over with." He wastes no more time with the ball of darkness. No more time for sarcasm. He heads towards Yuki, and past him and turns south. It was time to get this over with...whatever the fuck it was they were doing. (edited)
3
Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-10-2023 13:02
Yuki is about to answer Lars when he hears Nyr's comment. "Yeah, I think I'll keep my death a mystery for now. Thrill of living and all that. But thanks for the offer. Let us move along then." "As Nyr guessed, I picked up a mushroom around the corner, so we only have another to go. We can do this." He takes up the pace once more, getting as far as the next intersection, looking around to see if he can detect anything unusual.
Lars BOT 31-10-2023 14:22
- Shame. He shrugs, rebalancing his shield and gripping his spear tighter. He follows along.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 01-11-2023 02:55
Seeing as nothing is in the way, Yuki gestures to the others that the path is clear. Whether they should go south or east from this point is anyone's guess, so he's not too bothered by it.
Riannoc BOT 02-11-2023 10:44
"Hold, my Shadar-senses are tingling" He raises a hand as he sees a faint white familiar glow in the distance after catching up with Yuki. Probably a smart move, if only he remembers he's still in the big dome of darkness that nobody can see him. "I think I found our final mushroom, folks. Right there over the south ea--" Now he finally remembers. "-why do I even bother. Go fetch it little buddy." And Little John would put the lantern on the ground and move along with him to fetch the mushroom. Hopefully it is the mushroom. (edited)
DM [CreamPuff] BOT 02-11-2023 12:14
The mushroom is plucked and gently carried by little John, glowing in midair with its pale white light. -- wow! You've finally acquired all the materials you need for your suicide mission!!
Lars BOT 02-11-2023 14:45
- Are we done, then? Can we get the Hells out of here? I'm freezing. He still holds his gear, wary of new threats.
Riannoc BOT 02-11-2023 14:47
"I believe so, unless we plan to turn this to a business, which means we'll need a few more of these mushrooms" Long silence. "I'm joking, let's get off this rock." He puts the mushroom into his bag, the normal one, not the magical one, mind.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 02-11-2023 15:05
Yuki looks at the others from where he stands, ready to intervene if anything pops out of nowhere. Though he can't help but exhale a sigh of relief at the announcement that the last mushroom was found. They could finally get out of here! They had summoned a real-life-like dragon to scare yetis away, one of which bumped into Nyr (by "bumped", read "impaled") and temporarily killed him. He was brought back from the other side by berries. Yes, berries. Magical berries. Made by himself, no less. So resourceful. And then they all decided that the best course of action was to keep going, so they did. They caught up and minced a yeti while Rimamoc was dealing with his own big black ball. He was proud of it, wore it like a glove too. So masculine. Then they walked around and they picked up a scroll of snowballs. Yes, snowballs. In an area filled with snow. No, it's not hard to make snowballs when you're surrounded by snow. Yet here it was. Why was it there? No one knows! So mysterious." And then some sort of lamp made them all feel weird and lonely. Ohh, the feels, man. The feels, I tell ya. Dark and twisted. Where did it come from? Well that, too, is a mystery. Rumours have it that Ricmonoc has something to do with it, but who knows. Not a lamp Yuki wants anything to do with, though. So ominous. But now, here they are, with all the mushrooms needed to get out of here and ingest some deadly poison. Yop, that is the plan. All this effort and cold and dark and loneliness to get something that would allow them to kill themselves safely. Yop. Have you ever seen these two words together? Killed safely? No? Yeah well, there's a reason for that. But let's not get into details. So responsible. And there ends the sigh of Yuki. So meaningful.

As Riannoc and his big flock of black corvids return from the deep recesses of the cave, the last delicate icy mushroom in hand, both the party would hear the faintest whisper coming from the other unexplored and unseen corner of the cave.
Riannoc BOT 02-11-2023 22:33

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 02-11-2023 23:59

Riannoc BOT 03-11-2023 12:02

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 03-11-2023 16:22

Riannoc BOT 03-11-2023 19:18

Nyr BOT 04-11-2023 05:32

Yuki Northernfur BOT 04-11-2023 06:47
Yuki listens carefully and can also discern the whispers. At least, he thinks he can. All of the earlier feelings may still be playing tricks in his head. He cannot wait to get out of there. "I agree, let's get out of here," he half-whispers. "Whatever that is, it can't be good news. I hardly think a friendly human passed all the yetis and trolls unnoticed to go deeper into the cave. If they could, then they could do it the opposite way. They're all good. Out we go!" Yuki stands his ground, waiting for Riannoc. He did not wish to leave anyone too far behind. He is relieved they have all the mushrooms they need, but sightly apprehensive towards the next step of their journey, namely their calculated death. But before all of that, they still needed to get out of the cave, and letting their guard down now could spell disaster. And so he intends to stay focused until they are back at the caravan. (edited)

Lars BOT 05-11-2023 00:09
Hearing what the party's best ears can pick up, Lars himself not being one of them, he considers the situation and stares pretty seriously at Riannoc. - What if its a suffering spirit? Can we leave in good consciousness knowing we're condemning it to however many years of solitude and famine, until someone else comes along to release it? He approaches him, taking a glance at Nyr - who is now much closer, and private, to these things too. - I have no doubt its something horribly murderous waiting for us. But still, if its an undying soul, it deserves release.
1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 05-11-2023 12:10
Yuki listens to Lars with his brows furrowed. Helping an undying soul? Why? This is Barovia, there would be no end to this! If he wants to play Ghost Hero, he can just stand in the cemetery around midnight and have a buffet of souls to help. The shifter's about to argue when a thought quickly crosses his mind. What would happen if he became such a soul? And people would just ignore him, leaving him to suffer for all eternity, when it would be so simple to remedy his problem? Flashes of the feelings of loneliness he felt earlier pierce his heart. That would be the saddest, most excruciatingly frustrating situation to find oneself in. And it may, just may, maybe, perhaps, potentially, be the case here. He looks towards the darkness that would lead them to the exit, then back towards the whispers. Another look towards the outdoors, safety. And another towards the menacing unknown. Freedom. Doom. Fresh air. Trap. Living. Unliving.... He can't believe he's hesitating. The choice would seem so simple to pretty much anyone you asked. And yet, Lars managed to pull a string that Yuki wasn't sure was still there after all this time in this realm: compassion. He tilts his head back further than necessary, his eyes so far back in their sockets that they are completely white. He lets a frustrated, low grunt of resignation. "Fine... Fine!! We can go see what it is. Just look at it! At the first sign of danger, we pivot 180 degrees and head straight for the exit. No if's, no but's! Got it?" he tells Lars who can feel the annoyance in his tone. It's barely muffled. "Is everyone ok with that?" he asks the other two.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 06-11-2023 06:10
*At Lars' obstinate insistence, the party reluctantly approaches the final corner of the cave they have yet to see fully with great caution. As they get closer, the whisper stops. All they see before them, slumped against a rocky wall, is a bent-over skeleton. A rusty mace sits at its feet, as well as a shield. Around the skeleton's neck is an amulet of tarnished brass. Engraved on the amulet is a white skull that's missing its jaw, stark against its background of a purple sunburst. For those of you who have met cleric friends, this looks a lot like a holy symbol some of them may have worn around their necks.*
Lars BOT 06-11-2023 18:43
*A quick glance at the holy symbol and it immediately jumps to mind. He's gonna regret making everyone come here, isn't he?* - That's the symbol of Cyric, Prince of Lies and God of Betrayal. He looks around to his companions, and the gigantic ball of darkness that is Riannoc, then sighs. - Perhaps we should just leave it be... He taps the butt of his spear on the ground, thinking for quite a while, before clearing his throat and raising his voice. - Do not try our hands with deception and trickery, spirit! We come here to offer release and rest! Don't you want to reunite with your god on your chosen afterlife? Show yourself! He bangs on the shield with the shaft of the spear, empasizing his last words and causing a loud clang.
1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 07-11-2023 02:32
Staying behind to have a better view of the surroundings, Yuki is more preoccupied by what could flank them than the skeleton in front of them. Who knows what is still lurking in the depths of this cave? Lars's voice echoes back to him: "That's the symbol of Cyric, Prince of Lies and God of Betrayal." Yuki is not superstitious by nature. Good luck and bad luck and things that can provide one or curse you with the other, there's just something not right with that line of thought. But creatures and, in this case, deities that actively try to lure you to hurt you absolutely exist, as has been proven countless times in this realm. So when he hears Lars state that they should leave it be, Yuki feels a wave of relief. Why tempt fate? Which only made it even more shocking to hear, only a few seconds later, Lars banging on the shield and literally calling out for the spirit to come out! "What are you doing?" he murmur-yells. "What you say and what you do are opposite! Leave it be, that's a sign of danger and as promised, we're turning around and getting out! Let's go! That amulet is shining, too. For some reason, there's this... transmutation word coming in my head when I look at it. I don't know why or what it means, but I don't like it!" "Come, don't antagonize murderous gods!"

Nyr BOT 09-11-2023 00:24
Nyr was shocked that he cared. Lars had hit on something he didn't know he had in him; Respect, empathy, and compassion for the dead. This was new. He lagged behind while he processed these new feelings. He was honestly disappointed the spirit didn't respond. Maybe it wasn't a spirit at all, and a mere trick like suspected. But...what if? He makes a mental note to possibly come back and investigate further. So many feelings flooded him. He still battled with the thoughts of insecurity concerning this mission as a whole. What the hell was he doing? Should he let the past be the past? What does he hope to accomplish with all of this? And why did he deem it necessary to put people he cared about in danger? That last one was actually easy to answer: He was weak...and selfish. There was no telling what was ahead, but he knew he didn't have the strength to face it alone. Nyr'd thoughts were interrupted and he was shunted back to the present by the call of warning. That fucking yeti. What better way to clear your head than indiscriminate violence? "I have a score to settle with this one. It dies"

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 09-11-2023 02:13
Yuki Northernfur BOT 09-11-2023 02:30

It's still in the process of healing, so it's most likely already hurting. What a great place to start! He pulls back his nonexistent bowstring which then appears as a ray of light, and the bright arrow that emerges from between Yuki's fingers flies towards its target, plunging deep into the wound before exploding in small sparks of light. Dread Wanderer(Nyr) BOT 09-11-2023 03:07
Instead of arrows flying out of the bow, dark shadows start to seep from the mouths of the faces. The shadows quickly consume the bow completely, before traveling up Nyrs arms and onto the entirety of his body. Darkness consumes Nyr. Unlike Riannoc's solid darkness, Nyrs has a sinister, almost trickster, feel to it. The ancient darkness of the Fey Realms taking control Two shadow arrows streak from the darkness towards the creature. One of them making contact. The black, smokey, tendrils leap from the arrow and claw at the eyes of the lonely creature. From the ball of fey darkness, a figure appears. Nyrs Dread Wanderer form floats a foot off the ground. His dark brown leathers replaced by corrupted bark armor. His face, covered by a hood and mask. The face, a shroud of darkness, with two glowing blue orbs. A whisper like growl escapes the dark face of the being "You know nothing of loneliness.... see the shadows of my life.... feel what true loneliness is" The tendrils find purchase and seep into the creatures eyes, exposing it to a vision of Nyrs past... and the feeling of infinite pitiful loneliness and sadness A few of the screaming faces on Nyrs bow begin to smile in sinister delight. Their eyes matching Nyrs blue orbs, as the creature succumbs to true loneliness.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 09-11-2023 19:00
*The angry large furry creature screams out in pain as the shadar brothers strike him with multiple blasts of magic. He runs forward toward the ball of darkness, looking frustrated at not being able to lock down prey as he usually does with his sight. Instead he stops at the mouth of the tunnels and inhales. The air fills the creatures lungs as his upper torso visibly expands. Then comes the exhale. The air around you grows impossibly frigid, the heat cube's magic not working fast enough to defend you from the rush of frost that now surrounds Riannoc, Lars, and Yuki, who was perfectly hidden but caught in the splash zone. The two shadars manage to shiver through the brunt of the frostbite, but the shifter was caught off guard and feels his ears and the tip of his nose go numb almost instantly as heat is robbed from his body.* The creepy creature with dangling, sharp arms runs away a little bit from the dreadful form of the ranger but turns around to launch its arm -- stretching impossibly long with a deadly sharp point -- at Nyr. Nyr dodges it with ease, however.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 10-11-2023 03:29
Hidden in the ball of darkness, Yuki gets a false sense of security. The kind that people have thinking that if one can't see the enemy, then the enemy surely can't see you back. But that doesn't mean they can't attack. The ambient air becomes frigid, even more so than ever despite the cube. More than he remembers his home ever getting. Then Yuki understands, arguably too late, that this cold isn't natural. Had he seen the yeti, he may have been able to do something, but now he is caught in the frozen blast. His skin hardens, his whole body hurts. His limbs are losing sensitivity at an alarming speed. Quickly, he rolls out of the darkness to aim at the yeti, but his hands are numb to a point where he can't get the arrow to shoot correctly, and it passes by the monster to go explode in a thousand sparks of light on the wall next to it. Cursing under his breath, he dives back into the magical darkness, but doesn't stop until he's out on the other side, hopefully putting enough space between him and the others to avoid other attacks that target an area instead of a target.
Nyr BOT 10-11-2023 19:16
Nyrs dread form tilts it's head as it takes in the pitiful creature. Was this what becomes of those who die here? He didn't plan on finding out "Pitiful" The deep growling whisper floats through the air like a malice filled carrion bird waiting for its next meal The shadows begin to circle nyr faster and faster, enveloping him in a tornado of dark tendrils. Suddenly they dispearse....into nothing. The Dread Wanderer is gone, nothing but pieces of shadow floating down to the ground. Like ashes lazily falling from a house fire From a few feet to the side, two sleek black arrows streak through the cold cave air. The creature catches both of them with their torso, but is able to shake off the shadowed memories of Nyrs past before they can take hold. (edited)
Riannoc BOT 10-11-2023 19:47

Yuki Northernfur BOT 13-11-2023 23:52
Seeing the yeti go down, Yuki switches his attention to the other combat apparently going on simultaneously. "Come on, it seems we're not done yet," he encouragingly says to Nyr who joined him a bit earlier. He starts moving, following the sounds of battle until he can see, from around the corner of a column, Riannoc's black sphere of magical darkness. Some scene is going on inside. He still has no clue as to what is asking for hugs, but the feeling he gets is akin to a nightmare asking if it can come and play with your mind right before you fall asleep, so obviously the answer is "no". It's still nice of it to ask permission first though, it's a polite nightmare. Getting the best line of sight he can to the sphere without getting too close, Yuki drops his bow to pick the wand of magic missiles at his belt, ready to obliterate the hugger as soon as an opportunity arises. (edited)
Dread Wanderer(Nyr) BOT 14-11-2023 01:57
The attempt to go inflict fear to the yeti didn't pan out, as it was struck down before Nyr could get to it. A low growl leaves the masked face as the shadows streak back to go after his new arch nemesis. Unable to see the creature, he stands there, bow pulled. The faces on the wood silently screaming in anticipation.
Riannoc BOT 14-11-2023 11:14
His brother told him to dodge, but dodgest Riannoc did not. "Oh nice! Lars' sticky white substance, exactly what I needed!" Covered in unsolicited webbing, he decides to meld to the shadows and reappears somewhere further. The dome of shadow ravens moves as he did, but not before swarming the lonely monster with pecks and bruises.
Lars BOT 14-11-2023 19:16
*Once his Brother retreats to cover him with the ravens, Lars has no choice but to step up and hope for the best! He carefully navigates the darkness until he emerges right at the edge of his own restraining spell, and sees the creature about to move up! He points the spear and darkness slither to the monster, cursing it with a similar ability to what Riannoc used to kill the yeti.* - When my Sticky White Goo Spell appears, that means I have finished my job! He thrusts forward twice, forcefully, and shoots more white energy blasts at the creeper! The rays burst into its body, causing the curse to lash out and squeeze the very soul off of the creature - but it still lives! - ... Or not. You guys can take care of it yourselves, right? I'm spent. He retreats inside the ball to curl up and maybe have a nap.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 14-11-2023 19:24
*The shadow creature cries, openly wailing. You would probably be sympathetic at how pathetic it is if it weren't actively trying to spear you with its sharpened arms. And spear you it does. As it exclaims, Nyr suddenly loses his footing as his body flies toward the creature, having been pulled in as if by a harpoon strike. He also feels his vitality drained through the piercing arm itself and his head aches with eerie loneliness.*
Yuki Northernfur BOT 14-11-2023 22:48
When Riannoc‚Äôs sphere of magical darkness recedes, the creature that was engulfed in it is revealed to Yuki for the first time. It is not only ugly, but brings forth a feeling of macabre pity, like something you feel sorry for but know deep down that it has no place in this world. It should go to a better plane. And so he lets seven darts shoot from his wand in the hopes that it would be enough. The light bluish arrowheads of light all shoot in slightly different directions. If they were going in a straight line, they would all miss their target, but they seem to know where they need to go, and all of them curve their trajectories like smooth homing missiles to hit the monstrosity in the back in rapid succession. It yelps in pain, which is aggravated by an additional arrow from Nyr. The latter seems to be the last straw, and the weakened monster, now most likely on its last leg, turns angrily towards Nyr. But interestingly, it doesn‚Äôt rush over, which would be expected from something that wants hugs so desperately. That‚Äôs when Yuki notices that it is stuck in some weird-looking white substance. Is that what Lars shouted about earlier? Dodge the sticky white stuff? So Riannoc had had to rid himself of this? Or maybe he was still covered in it? Ew‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs when the harpoon shoots forth to grapple and pull Nyr straight into the white goo. So now Lars, Riannoc, Nyr, and even the enemy, had partook in the smearing of the thick white stuff. Riannoc probably had it all over his legs. Being pulled so quickly and losing balance, Nyr had to touch the floor so he had it all over his hands, and the impact had splashed a bit of it on the monster‚Äôs face. Yuki dared not think which part of Lars‚Äô body it was ejected from. . (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 15-11-2023 04:59
For the second time today, Yuki feels like he‚Äôs on the sidelines, like he doesn‚Äôt belong, like he‚Äôs not invited to the activities the others organize. But this time, for some reason, he doesn‚Äôt mind so much. What is he really missing here? But hey, don‚Äôt knock it ‚Äòtill you try it, right? He‚Äôll have to ask if he can be part of their private sticky parties one day. Seeing Nyr in a predicament brings Yuki back to reality. ‚ÄúOk, that‚Äôs enough!‚Äù he says out loud to no one in particular. He pulls his bowstring of light as he studies the monster, finding a weak spot in its side while its arms are busy holding Nyr in a tight embrace. He shoots, this time his fingers being almost back to normal, and the arrow hits through the soft spot and explodes inside its stomach. It is dead before it hits the floor, but Yuki cannot shake the image of one of the ugliest things he‚Äôs ever seen drop to his knees, looking up at Nyr with a smile of satisfaction, its strength expended, a little white goo on the side of the mouth, before going into a sleep from which it would never wake up.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 15-11-2023 05:02

Dread Wanderer(Nyr) BOT 15-11-2023 23:19
The Dread Wanderer, Nyr, stands there for a moment. The creatures spike like appendage still deep in his chest, even as the body falls limp He grabs the arm and slowly removes it, not making a sound, never breaking eye contact with the creatures now lifeless eyes. There's a sickly sound as the last of the arm is removed and blood and chunks of viscera fall to the ground. The shadows that surround Nyr begin to funnel into the hole left by the arm, quicker and quicker it fills the hole. Nyrs body rocks violently, but he maintains his footing, and his death stare on the creature. After a moment, the shadow that consumed Nyr is all contained in the wound, protecting the exposed area from further harm. The Dread Wanderer gone, replaced by the familiar stone cold Eladrin form of Nyr (edited)

Nyr BOT 15-11-2023 23:23

Yuki Northernfur BOT 16-11-2023 13:11
"I agree, let's get out of here," Yuki chimes to the tune, joining the others on their way outside. A dull grey sky like the one they have been seeing every day since their arrival in this realm welcomes them. There have been very few positive qualifiers for that sky; always cloudy, looking like it might rain at any moment, and when it does, you're not sure if it'll be blood, mud, or whatever. But right now, it looks so bright to Yuki, so vast, so far. Freedom. The freezing mountain wind, barely kept at bay by the thermal cubes, is almost appreciated on his skin. Almost. Still a bit too much. As they walk down the slopes, keeping an eye on their surroundings and hoping every other yeti in the vicinity "unfortunately" fell down a cliff, Yuki turns to Nyr and breaks the silence. "So, what's the plan now that we have the mushrooms? I mean, I assume we are still on track to eat deadly poison, but besides that, have you planned the details? Do we have to prepare these mushrooms in any particular way, or just take a big ol' bite?" (edited)
Riannoc BOT 16-11-2023 14:57

The shadow elf also stretches his body at the sight of the outdoors, truly one of the few things to be enjoyed no matter how grim the situation is. Twice moreso when one plans to kill oneself after the hike is done. "Where should we park our... corporeal bodies while we do the deed?" Feels weird to say that.
Lars BOT 16-11-2023 21:50

Riannoc BOT 17-11-2023 16:10

On the other side is the end of the bridge as they know it, far enough to let them pass by unnoticed be the conjured gargoyles. "Ha! What do you know, perhaps one day my loathe of this dirty place would be our ticket out." Yuki Northernfur BOT 18-11-2023 03:37
Yuki looks at Lars' gaping hole. It is the first time he sees one in the flesh. It's so.. foreign and intriguing. Yuki has never dared swing to that side. The magical side. Some people had told him it was wrong, that he should stick to the martial, something everyone was doing. But curiosity had always been there. He crouches to softly touch the rim of the portal. It's quite a unique feeling. He gently puts a finger inside. Nothing bad happens. Maybe getting this new experience here is meant to be. "Sorry Nyr, I know this is tempting, but may I use this hole first, please? It shouldn't take very long, I'm pretty excited!" Yuki stands back up and takes two steps back, getting mentally ready to do something he never thought he would. "It's my first time, I'm a little nervous..." he says. He takes a deep breath, steels himself, and jumps into the hole.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 20-11-2023 14:46
The sight of their carriage and horse still being there and in one piece brings relief to Yuki and the rest of the group. They prepare to depart, unhindered by yetis, ugly lonely creatures, or forest madmen. Which is fortunate, as Yuki‚Äôs mind is preoccupied with other things. On their way down the slopes, they had kept mostly quiet, eager to make it back alive and saving their remaining strength for the descent. But now that they are in the relative safety of the wagon, their minds have more leeway to wander and think about what they had just gone through. ‚ÄúNyr, may I have a word with you?‚Äù he asks the Eladrin. Accounting for the limited space of the transport and how a conversation would be very difficult to keep private, even if it isn‚Äôt his intention to do so, he adds out loud for the other two occupants: ‚ÄúEveryone is welcome to join this little chat. Actually, it‚Äôd be better this way.‚Äù A few minutes later, everyone is gathered inside the cabin, sitting in a circle, waiting for Yuki to speak. He‚Äôs never been great at confrontation, and this was more of a meeting anyway, but at this point he has needs for answers, and so he begins. ‚ÄúI am aware that I am the newest member of the group, even temporarily, and so it may not sound like much coming from me, but I wanted to start by saying‚Ä¶ good job‚Ä¶ in there.‚Äù He offers a meek thumbs up. The others can immediately see that he‚Äôs outside his comfort zone; one of those people that are as bad at giving compliments as they are at getting them. . (edited)
Yuki Northernfur BOT 20-11-2023 14:46
He clears his throat before continuing. ‚ÄúI think we did well in general, but there is place for amelioration. One of us was momentarily taken down,‚Äù he says, throwing a glance at Nyr, ‚Äúand I was almost frozen in place. The dragon illusion was impeccable, though the ball of darkness could be better used in other circumstances maybe; it makes it hard for others to navigate in a tight space. Of course, I have a long way to go myself, as my battling options are too limited; I need to broaden my horizons.‚Äù ‚ÄúBut all in all, we did well. I mean, I think we did well‚Ä¶ we all came out of it in one piece at the very least. ... That being said‚Ä¶‚Äù His face is now serious, with a tint of nervousness. ‚ÄúDuring our trip up the mountain, I have seen all of you dabble in magic that has to deal with darkness, shadows, and changes of forms. I have seen you transform and tap into powers that are beyond my understanding. I cannot help but feel like I‚Äôm lacking some crucial information about all of you, that there are things kept from me, on purpose or not, and that makes it hard for me to do my best. I cannot fight properly or help you properly if I don‚Äôt know who or what you are, what you are capable of, and what I‚Äôm actually getting into or why.‚Äù He pauses, then faces Nyr directly. ‚ÄúYou are the one who started this expedition. You have a goal, and a means to get there. I want to help you, because I am invested in the ramifications that can come from confirming astral wandering is possible in this plane. But I need you to be honest with me.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat are we getting ourselves into here?‚Äù (edited)
Nyr BOT 21-11-2023 01:37
He sits silently and listens to Yuki, absorbing every word. Typically when people are being serious, Nyr does everything he can to lighten the mood. He's gotten the reputation of a sarcastic asshole, and works very hard to keep it up. But not now. The next part of the journey wasn't anything to take lightly, and Yuki had earned his trust and respect. He gives the Shifter a nod, gentle to express gratitude, but with purposeful intent. "My name is Nyrahs Vala'dhor. I'm two and a half centuries old, hailing from the fey wild. A beautiful place on the surface, but if you dig deep enough, full of ancient darkness." "For the longest time I worked for some...less than moral people. I have a knack for getting in and out of places in the blink of an eye. That, in combination with my knowledge of the flora of the fey wild and my natural tracking and survival abilities made me useful to them." He pauses for a moment, as if considering what details to leave out. "It paid well, as it should, It was dangerous work and they were well connected with the Unseelie Court. But it put a roof over our heads, and I knew my daughter would never be found wanting." "The most common job I took, was the simple collection and delivery of dangerous plants between the fey wild and the material plane. People pay good money for exotic, life threatening plants." To the keen eyed amongst you, you can see just how difficult his past is to recall. Tears begin to form, but he keeps them at bay. His voice, usually arrogant, develops a slight quiver. "I failed a job. The harvest of the plant went wrong, I got knocked out for days and missed the delivery window. There's one thing you don't do with criminal organization, and that's get between them and their money" The longest pause yet, It's quite obvious Nyr does not want to recall the next part of his story. But a deep reluctant sigh later, he continues.....
1
Nyr BOT 21-11-2023 02:02
"I returned home...to find a pile of ash and broken memories. And my daughter....my sweet Amelia.....gone." ..... "They left a message, claiming the debt to be paid. He favorite teddy, with its eyes gouged out" A single tear breaks past his well fortified emotional wall, flowing slowly down his cheek and beginning to freeze before dropping off as a beautifully tragic snowflake. "The next 80 years....100 years... I don't know.....time just kinda of stands still after her passing, I searched for ways to being her back. Obviously I failed. I am nothing but failure to the one person I wasn't supposed to fail." He let's out another heavy sigh, gently shaking his head. A look of determination and deep anger blotting out the sadness that was present just a moment before. "Years of searching and failing, I began to move on, to heal. A druid helped me learn more aboit the natural spirits of the world. With his help, I came to accept that her spirit was still with me, and that was the best I was going to get." He let's out a sharp, but almost silent, whistle. A moment later the familiar owl flies up to the wagon, perching on top of it. "Finding Mia helped heal those wounds even more. A part of me believes Amelia's spirit is in there. But, I'm just too cynical to completely buy in." "Thats who I am, and who were dealing with. They are monsters. Killing an innocent child over a few coin." He stares deep into your eyes to let the weight of the words set in. "Now....onto the shadow darkness transformation thing. Well.....that's new and I don't fully understand it. But I believe it's deliberate. The first instance of it happened just moments after I received the letter, that kicked this grand adventure off." Once again, he pauses to let all the words sink in. There's a definite look of uncertainty on his face, but it's quickly covered back up with the anger.....

Yuki Northernfur BOT 21-11-2023 08:54
Sitting with his legs crossed, his elbows resting on his knees and his interlocked fingers gently pressed on his lips, the shifter listens intently to Nyr's story. No one interrupts. This is a moment when jokes do not have their place. It's a pouring of the heart among people that are trusted. It is not to be taken lightly, and everyone seems to understand that. Yuki feels better after the reveal of Nyr's past. He has a better picture of where he's coming from, what's on his mind; his motivations, his scars, his pain. He feels like he is part of something, instead of just being there for the ride. It's a bonding feeling. "Thank you for sharing. It must have been difficult, but I have a much better picture and will most likely be better at assisting you." He turns to the other companions in the circle. "What about you two? Riannoc BOT 21-11-2023 21:37
The elf hears everything from the driver seat at the front. But yet he said nothing as his wagon slowly turns to a trailer for a camping trip. Besides... "...I'm afraid I myself am in a state where even I am not sure how much of my past is true. But if you still care to know about how I came to this magic..." <Snap> *There it is, a fingersnap, Riannoc's alternative of tapping his trusty cane to the ground to summon his control over shadow matter. The air chills, the light dims as the nearby shadows converge to the middle of the room where they sit and forms a dark alleyway of an already darkened world, only familiar to those who have been there. Indeed, it is none other that Shadowfell itself. The dockyards in the Drowned Quarter of Gloomwrought, specifically. Before you stands a pale child, so tattered and fouled by filth. His hair damp and musty, not unlike seaweed covering the entirety of his face. The dryness of his skin a testament to the salty, blackened seawater affecting the foggy air. By all accounts you are looking at a walking dead, all traces of life soon to be extinguished! But his eyes, they lack the element of defeat, only anger. Anger so intense it could melt iron, anger that keeps the child alive despite his broken body and kneecap. He limps forward, with only a crude walking stick on his person as he proceeds to use it as a weapon, clubbing an adult thug to near death in the nearby alleyway for a piece of stale bread. Certainly not a feast, but the boy treats it like one as it eats in elation, face devoid of guilt.* "And he still thinks that bread was the best ever." *Unfortunately, the boy would learn to finish the deed, for his victim rose against and overpowered him a heartbeat later. That's it. The boy would soon face death. But pure spite and all that rage awakened something different in him, as tendrils of shadow matter would tear his surroundings, just as the illusion falls apart.*

Riannoc BOT 21-11-2023 21:47
"Safe to say, my first time was in a dark alleyway with a man triple my age."
1
Lars BOT 21-11-2023 21:55
*Now, elves don't sleep. Everyone knows that. Trancing is a particularly interesting phenomenon that goes by mostly ignored, after the first or second time you catch an elf dead-eyed looking at you while you sleep. They're not there, there, not actually. They're just kind of there, and kind of somewhere else entirely. That "else" being private to each elf, something not many speak of - since it's a glimpse into one's mind and soul. So Lars is there, sure, but not there, there. Only after the long trek down the mountain did it become very apparent that he was incredibly exhausted and damaged, his breathing growing heavier and his footsteps slower each mile. When the party finally reached the wagon, he silently crawled up inside and curled up in a corner in a fetal position. He wasn't sleeping, and you sometimes could hear a grumble or mumble here and there, along with little flashes of magic - sometimes at the perfectly dramatic moment, to highlight a pause, or raise a crescendo on each of everyone else's talking. Maybe he was paying attention, maybe it was just a coincidence, but in any case... He didn't seem interested in sharing how he came upon his powers, or how his early years were all sad and gloomy.*
Nyr BOT 22-11-2023 00:53
Nyr looks at Lars while he rests, trying to understand his brothers hesitation. Its not like Lars to miss an opportunity to be dramatic. He wasn't bothered by him not sharing, that was his right. And he definately needed to rest, for someone that could summon such powerful magics, he was a frail little guy. "Lars and Ric.....Riannoc were there on my first day in Barovia. All of us came through the mists withing a few days of each other, I believe. Spent the evening at the tavern amongst others....a lot of who aren't with us anymore." Again, he pauses reminiscing aboit those who were there that night. The night the lasting bonds were formed oit of mutual survival. So many lost... "We parted ways after that night, but fate seems to keep bringing us back together. Picking up a random job in Vallaki to find the others had also picked up the same job. In normal circumstances, I would believe it to be coincidence. But the connection I feel with these two, and others who have left us, can't be dismissed as coincidence."
Yuki Northernfur BOT 22-11-2023 12:16
Yuki also looks at Lars. Through slightly squinted eyes, he notes his silence but doesn't comment on it. As much as he could be awake, he sure looks like he is resting. It'd be better for everyone involved not to press the matter. He turns back his attention to Nyr. "I see," he concludes at the end of the explanation. "You all had it pretty rough even before getting dumped in here. I can't relate to all the misfortune and difficulties you've faced; my life was surprisingly uneventful after all. Peaceful even. I still don't know why it is that I got yanked from that to end up in this shithole..." "And bonds created through hardships and uncertainty are the ones that overcome time and distance. You are lucky to have found each other.* "I'm sure you wish to bury these memories, or at least some of them, deep into the void of forgetfulness, but they are an important part of who you are and they continue to forge who you will be. Cherish the good ones for how they make you feel, and the bad ones for how they make you grow." The wagon is now entering the city's walls. They are arriving at their destination, and soon embarking on the second stretch of their adventure. "I think we should rest," he announces to his companions. He thinks for a second before adding. "Again, I thank you for trusting me with your past. We have not known each other for long, but we have already climbed up Mt. Ghakis together, fought together, and survived through each other's abilities. I consider you all more than mere acquaintances or means to verify a hypothesis about astral wandering." He looks directly at Nyr. "And what happened to your family doesn't sit well with me. At all. I'll feel better after I'm sure they are deader than dead. I support your quest for justice, your quest for vengeance, your quest for forgiveness, your quest for amends... whatever you call it, I'll be on your side to kick their asses when the time comes, you can count on it!" Riannoc BOT 23-11-2023 15:53
"Bury these memories? I'm afraid it's not as straightforward as it seems, but let's save that for another day." As the owner of the wagon, Riannoc finds a place to park in front of the Blue Water Inn owned and operated by the Martikovs. People come and go all the time in Vallaki, and it's not a suspicious place to park a wagon. Plus, Ves likes the water and food in the stable. "For now, let's find a place to rest indeed."
Lars BOT 23-11-2023 22:01
- That's a good idea. I need to get some stuff from a couple craftsmen while we're here. Tomorrow, we die. *He stands up like he wasn't basically braindead for the last couple hours during travel. Riannoc BOT 23-11-2023 22:58

Yuki Northernfur BOT 23-11-2023 23:48
"I do as well," he says, preparing to leave the wagon. "Let's all meet back here in the morning after we have rested. See you then!" He exits the wagon onto the streets of Vallaki, gathering his things before resting for the night. He would meet them at the wagon in the morrow.
Riannoc BOT 25-11-2023 15:07
*Back from Bethel‚Äôs, Riannoc‚Äôs bag of potions does look a lot more loaded than before. The shadow shield he conjures to get out of many problems are also flickering with vigor. He‚Äôs as ready as ever.*

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 26-11-2023 21:58
*The night comes and the night goes. A night finally of uninterrupted, much needed rest. Yuki is almost accustomed to the new scent that accompanies him everywhere he goes, by now. As day breaks, the party reassembles in front of the Blue Water Inn. The smell of wolf bacon wafts out from the door that is ajar. The fire inside is roaring and warm, while the air has gotten quite nippy as the seasons churned in Barovia. Ves seems to have rested better in a stable as well, with access to a soft hay pile and fresh water, and now comes the question of ingesting the Vor Thomil Nightshade, along with the protective powers of the frosty mushrooms you acquired.* *Here is the leap of faith. Most importantly, do you trust each other?* Where will you embark on this next leg of your journey?

Riannoc BOT 27-11-2023 10:38
"So." In one of the many rooms in the Blue Water Inn, there sits the shadow elf on the room's only chair. Mind you, he refuses to sit on the floor. His cloak is worn along with all of his other equipment. One hand holds the grip of his cane while the other is fidgeting the nightshade and the mushroom. "Lock the door, block the window, get this over with before people start any unpleasant rumours about three elves and their fox. Sounds simple enough." He eyes his other allies in the room, scanning them one by one, Nyr in particular. "Is your heart in the right place?"
Yuki Northernfur BOT 27-11-2023 15:09
The morning brings another bland, dull grey sky indistinguishable from the afternoon sky. The only indication that it is morning is the chill still present in the air from the previous night. It is not a morning like the others, however. After a night's rest, Yuki wakes to the heavy, unsettling feeling one gets before a serious operation in a hospital; as reassuring as the doctors may sound, the notion that something might go wrong weighs on your mind like a cannon ball pulling you towards the depths of the ocean. Having slept in a different room than the others due to the fact he had to go and fetch some things, he eventually found himself facing the door of the room they had set as a rendez-vous point. It looked so ominous, like it was the only thing between reality and insanity. He would lie if he said he hadn't stopped to consider all the ramifications of what they were about to do. In fact, he had stared at the door for multiple minutes, pondering if this was all worth it, weighing the pros and cons on his mental scale; one side tilting towards risking it for the desire of getting out of here, then towards survival, curiosity, then prudence. But in the end, morality won. What those guys did to Nyr's family was wrong in every sense of the word. He was brought up with a basic knowledge of righteousness, and it was raging inside of him. The fire lit the flame of courage, and he had turned the handle to join the others in the room. "So," he heard Riannoc say. "Lock the door, block the window, get this over with before people start any unpleasant rumours about three elves and their fox. Sounds simple enough." He has no idea what he is talking about. Foxes are great creatures, only pleasant rumours would come out of having one in your room. But then he heard the real question everyone had on their minds: "Is your heart in the right place?" Yuki looks at Nyr intently. It was a fair question. There would be no hesitating from here on.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 27-11-2023 19:40
The dried nightshade flowers each have 5 petals and are curled back like the tentacles of a baby octopus. In its prime, the flower would've looked like a star. It's the color of deep, lush purple, like a very ripe eggplant, and the saturation of the color has only deepened with the preservation process. The petals have dark streaks running through them, beautiful and foreboding. The yellow part of the flower is warm and bright, and the dried flowers smell faintly of sweet honeysuckle and the vegetal bitterness of underripe tomatoes.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-11-2023 03:18
He has been looking up at the ceiling for a while. A warm feeling is building in his stomach, but his veins are as cold as they feel they could be without turning to ice. It is an alien and very uncomfortable feeling. He closes his eyes and tunes the others out to better handle the sensations. He hears Lars and Nyr say something, but they sound like they are underwater, muffled, incomprehensible. Pearls of sweat are forming on Yuki‚Äôs forehead, on his back. It is so hot in his stomach. It has to be the poison. It‚Äôs feels like his organs are melting, like he swallowed lava. Yet, every heartbeat sends a wave of freezing cold sensations to calm it down. He can‚Äôt feel his extremities. He is shivering. This fire vs ice combat lasts for what seems like an eternity, though it may only have been a few minutes since they ingested the liquid. Yuki realizes that one cannot be swallowed without the other; both of them deadly on their own, they nullify each other when together, but the physical struggle takes a toll on the body and mind. How long has it been? How were the others faring? Slowly and painstakingly, like it is taking all his strength, Yuki tilts his head on the side and opens his eyes. His vision is blurry. He can‚Äôt seem to focus on things well. Riannoc is still sitting on his chair, his body limp. Nyr was smart enough to lay down on the bed. Their facial expressions denote the same pain as Yuki is experiencing. He listens. Silence. There are probably noises around them in the inn, outside the window, in adjacent rooms, but he can‚Äôt hear them. ba-dum What is this noise? ba-dum It‚Äôs so familiar, yet so odd. ba-dum . (edited)

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 30-11-2023 10:05
*As Yuki hears his own heartbeat slow down, until it only beats once every 30 seconds or so, the same thing is happening to each of the participants of Riannoc's tea within this room. The last thought that registers in Lars' brain as his palette tries to decipher the aroma and taste of the tea can only be described as... the thrill and terror of having been noticed by an undeniably attractive mature woman, with a sinister smile that shows she knows exactly what she wants and that she's not afraid to do anything to get it -- and what she wants is you. Her eyes are locked on you. Her voluptuous figure is leaning on you. Her legs are wrapped around you, until suddenly plunges her beautiful crimson nails into your chest, grabs your heart, and squeezes it until it stops. As everyone feels the blood in their veins freeze and cease to pump, your vision blurs into an intense white heat. An indeterminate amount of time later, your eyes open. Before they can focus and learn to adjust to the quality of light in your new environment, your nostrils are filled with the fragrance of grass. Not the wet, unruly grass that covers much of Barovia's wilds, but a lush, gentle grass that smells of the return of spring. It cushions the back of your head like pillows, and the four of you realize you're all lying on the ground atop a grassy knoll, holding hands, surrounded by wildflowers and bushes full of plump berries. Nyr would know that whatever the ground beneath and the firmament above are made of, it's from raw materials akin to the Feywild.*
DM [CreamPuff] BOT 30-11-2023 10:08
*As the pleasant awakening subsides, the next thought hits you. Not only does the plush grass cushion the back of your head, you can feel it cool and tickling against your entire back, from your neck down to your ankles. A gentle breeze blows by, bringing a cocktail of fragrances from lilies, asters, and roses, but it also brings a little chill to your your bare abdomen, thighs, and... By Strahd. It suddenly dawns on you that you're completely naked.* (edited)
